name: Akiflow
description: Akiflow is an AI-powered productivity platform that integrates tasks and calendars for efficient time management and scheduling.
longDescription: Akiflow is an all-in-one productivity app designed to streamline task management and scheduling by consolidating tasks from various tools into a unified platform. Founded in 2020 by Sebastiano Favaro and Nunzio Martinello, it leverages AI to automate task organization and enhance time-blocking methodologies. The app integrates with tools like Gmail, Slack, Asana, and Google Calendar, allowing users to manage their schedules and to-do lists in one place. Its mission is to reduce cognitive overload and help professionals, founders, and teams achieve clarity and productivity without burnout. By offering features like a command bar and keyboard shortcuts, Akiflow enables quick task capture and seamless calendar management. It is trusted by Y Combinator founders, VC analysts, and busy professionals for its clean UI and robust integrations.
features: Task consolidation pulls tasks from tools like Slack, Gmail, and Asana into a single inbox, reducing app-switching and improving organization.
Time-blocking functionality allows users to drag and drop tasks onto a calendar for structured daily planning and focused work.
AI-powered task assignment automatically organizes tasks based on priorities and schedules, optimizing daily workflows.
Seamless calendar sync integrates with Google Calendar and Outlook, providing a unified view of tasks and events.
Focus Timer helps users lock into deep work by minimizing distractions and tracking time spent on tasks.
Scheduling links enable easy sharing of availability for one-off or recurring meetings, streamlining coordination.
Rituals Assistant guides users in reviewing and planning their days to enhance focus and productivity.
Keyboard shortcuts and a command bar allow for rapid task creation and navigation, boosting efficiency.
Offline mode ensures users can work without an internet connection, maintaining productivity anywhere.
Progress visualization tracks task completion and time spent, helping users reflect on their productivity.
Two-way sync with tools like Todoist and Asana ensures changes made in Akiflow reflect in connected apps and vice versa.

faqs.question: What is Akiflow used for?
faqs.answer: Akiflow is a productivity app that consolidates tasks and calendars from multiple tools, enabling users to plan their day efficiently using time-blocking and AI-driven organization.

faqs.question: Does Akiflow offer a free trial?
faqs.answer: Yes, Akiflow provides a 7-day free trial with full access to all features, allowing users to test its functionality before committing to a paid plan.

faqs.question: Which apps does Akiflow integrate with?
faqs.answer: Akiflow integrates with over 3,000 tools, including Gmail, Slack, Asana, Trello, Notion, Todoist, and Google Calendar, via direct integrations or Zapier.

faqs.question: Is Akiflow suitable for team use?
faqs.answer: Akiflow supports team collaboration by allowing users to share availability and manage team billing, making it ideal for professionals and small teams.

faqs.question: Can I use Akiflow offline?
faqs.answer: Yes, Akiflow’s offline mode allows users to manage tasks and schedules without an internet connection, ensuring uninterrupted productivity.

faqs.question: How does Akiflow’s AI improve productivity?
faqs.answer: Akiflow’s AI automatically assigns tasks to optimal time slots based on priorities and user preferences, reducing manual planning and enhancing efficiency.

faqs.question: Is Akiflow secure for my data?
faqs.answer: Akiflow prioritizes data security, but specific details can be found in their privacy policy, and users can contact support@akiflow.com for clarification.

faqs.question: Does Akiflow support time tracking?
faqs.answer: Currently, Akiflow does not offer native time tracking, though this feature has been under review since 2021 based on user feedback.

faqs.question: Can I cancel my Akiflow subscription easily?
faqs.answer: Yes, Akiflow allows users to cancel their subscription anytime during the free trial or paid plan, with details outlined in their terms of service.
